titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 115: al-Muqaddimah al-Ghaznawīyah.

note: Title from title statement (f.4r) and colophon (f. 44r).

msContents.summary: Work about Hanafi practice. The first section is about the virtues of Abū Ḥanīfah, followed by sections on jurisprudence of rituals including ritual purification, prayer, traveler's prayer, Friday prayer, alms, and fasting.

supportDesc.extent: 48 leaves : 202 x 146 (155 x 106) mm, bound to 203 x 156 mm

binding.p: Light brown leather with envelope flap. Covers blind stamped with central mandorla with two pendants on the vertical axis and blind tooled frame.

origin.p: Copy completed in the month of Shaʻbān, 1095 AH (July/Aug. 1684) by al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn al-Dhahab (f. 44r).

provenance: Formerly owned by Maḥmūd ibn al-Shaykh al-Fattāḥ (inscription f. 1r).
